    imageSrc="/hero.jpg"
    imageAlt="Hero showcase"
    frameStyle="card"
  />
</ThemeProvider>

hero.name: HeroLogoBillboardSplit
hero.description: Hero section with split layout (description left, buttons right), large SVG text logo, and single framed media at bottom. Supports flex-col or flex-col-reverse layout order.
hero.details: Use for brand-focused landing pages that prioritize messaging and CTAs with flexible logo positioning. Features split layout on desktop with description text on the left (1/2 width) and up to 2 action buttons on the right, aligned to bottom of description. Large responsive SVG text logo fills the width and can be positioned above or below the split section using layoutOrder prop ('default' = split then logo, 'reverse' = logo then split). Media section at bottom can be displayed in simple card frame or browser mockup with address bar. Logo height adjusts responsively (1.0x on mobile, 0.8x on desktop). Description text is larger on desktop (text-3xl) than mobile (text-lg). Only first 2 buttons are displayed using slice(0, 2).

description.example: Create stunning, responsive websites with our comprehensive component library

layoutOrder.note: 'default' displays split section (description/buttons) then logo (flex-col). 'reverse' displays logo then split section (flex-col-reverse).

buttons.note: Only first 2 buttons are displayed using slice(0, 2). Uses theme.defaultButtonVariant for styling.

imageSrc.note: Supports external URLs with unoptimized prop

videoSrc.note: Takes precedence over imageSrc if both provided

imageAlt.note: Empty string marks image as decorative (aria-hidden)

frameStyle.note: 'card' displays media in simple card with padding. 'browser' wraps media in browser mockup with address bar and window controls.

hero.usage:
<ThemeProvider defaultButtonVariant="text-stagger" defaultTextAnimation="entrance-slide" borderRadius="pill" cardStyle="layered-gradient">
  <HeroLogoBillboardSplit 
    logoText="ACME" 
    description="Create stunning, responsive websites with our comprehensive component library" 
    buttons={[
      { text: 'Get Started', href: '#' },
      { text: 'Learn More', href: '#' }
    ]}
    layoutOrder="default"
    imageSrc="/hero.jpg"
    imageAlt="Hero showcase"
    frameStyle="browser"
  />
</ThemeProvider>

hero.name: HeroLogoBillboardSplitImage
hero.description: Hero section with grid/flex split layout featuring description+buttons stacked on left and image on right, large SVG text logo, and billboard media at bottom. Supports flex-col or flex-col-reverse layout order.
hero.details: Use for brand-focused landing pages that showcase products/services alongside messaging and CTAs. Features responsive split layout: on mobile uses CSS Grid to make the image match text height, on desktop uses flexbox with description/buttons stacked vertically on the left (2/5 width) and image on the right (1/3 width, aspect-video). Large responsive SVG text logo fills the width and can be positioned above or below the split section using layoutOrder prop ('default' = split then logo, 'reverse' = logo then split). Billboard media section at bottom can be displayed in simple card frame or browser mockup with address bar. Logo height adjusts responsively (1.0x on mobile, 0.8x on desktop). Description text is larger on desktop (text-3xl) than mobile (text-lg). Only first 2 buttons are displayed using slice(0, 2). Mobile uses grid-cols-[1fr_auto] to stretch image to text height, desktop uses flex-row with justify-between.

description.example: Clean Power, Anywhere. Instantly. Zero-emission energy solutions and more with. Delivered fast. Engineered to last.

layoutOrder.note: 'default' displays split section (description/buttons + image) then logo (flex-col). 'reverse' displays logo then split section (flex-col-reverse).

buttons.note: Only first 2 buttons are displayed using slice(0, 2). Uses theme.defaultButtonVariant for styling.

splitImageSrc.note: Image displayed in the split section on the right side. On mobile stretches to match text height using CSS Grid. Supports external URLs with unoptimized prop

splitVideoSrc.note: Takes precedence over splitImageSrc if both provided

splitImageAlt.note: Empty string marks image as decorative (aria-hidden)

imageSrc.note: Billboard section image at bottom. Supports external URLs with unoptimized prop

videoSrc.note: Takes precedence over imageSrc if both provided

imageAlt.note: Empty string marks image as decorative (aria-hidden)

frameStyle.note: 'card' displays billboard media in simple card with padding. 'browser' wraps media in browser mockup with address bar and window controls.

hero.usage:
<ThemeProvider defaultButtonVariant="text-stagger" defaultTextAnimation="entrance-slide" borderRadius="pill" cardStyle="layered-gradient">
  <HeroLogoBillboardSplitImage 
    logoText="POWERFLOW" 
    description="Clean Power, Anywhere. Instantly. Zero-emission energy solutions and more with. Delivered fast. Engineered to last." 
    buttons={[
      { text: "Let's Talk Power", href: '#' },
      { text: 'Learn more', href: '#' }
    ]}
    layoutOrder="default"
    splitImageSrc="/product.jpg"
    splitImageAlt="Power solution showcase"
    imageSrc="/hero.jpg"
    imageAlt="Hero showcase"
    frameStyle="card"
  />
</ThemeProvider>

hero.name: HeroBillboardScroll
hero.description: Full-screen hero section with centered text and media card that animates with 3D perspective transforms on scroll (desktop only).
hero.details: Use for modern, interactive landing pages showcasing products, dashboards, or applications with scroll-triggered effects. On desktop, the media card animates from rotated (20deg X-axis) and scaled (1.05) to flat and normal scale as user scrolls down. Mobile displays a static 3D-rotated card without animation to avoid performance issues. Features centered TextBox above the animated card with consistent Billboard styling. Requires ReactLenis for smooth scroll tracking.

description.example: Experience smooth, performant animations as you scroll through your content

imageSrc.note: Image to display in the animated card. Supports external URLs with unoptimized prop

videoSrc.note: Video to display in the animated card. Takes precedence over imageSrc if both provided

imageAlt.note: Empty string marks image as decorative (aria-hidden)

desktop.rotateX: Animates from 20deg to 0deg based on scroll progress
desktop.scale: Animates from 1.05 to 1 based on scroll progress
desktop.note: Uses Framer Motion's useScroll and useTransform for smooth scroll-linked animations

mobile.note: Separate static div implementation to prevent performance issues and hydration errors

structure.href: string - Link destination (optional). External URLs (https://, http://, www.) open in new tab. Internal values (e.g., 'about', 'contact') scroll to #about, #contact sections
structure.props: Partial<ButtonPropsForVariant> - Additional button props like className, textClassName (optional)

examples: { text: 'Get Started', onClick: () => console.log('Get Started clicked') }
buttonRules.note: Button variant is controlled by ThemeProvider's defaultButtonVariant. Border radius is controlled by ThemeProvider's borderRadius (options: 'sharp', 'rounded', 'soft', 'pill'). All sections should be wrapped in a single ThemeProvider at the app/page level to maintain consistent styling across the entire site.

hero.usage:
<ThemeProvider defaultButtonVariant="hover-bubble" defaultTextAnimation="entrance-slide" borderRadius="pill">
  <HeroBillboardScroll 
    title="Scroll Animations" 
    description="Experience smooth, performant animations as you scroll through your content" 
    tag="Unleash the Power" 
    imageSrc="/dashboard.jpg" 
    imageAlt="Dashboard preview"
    buttons={[{ text: 'Get Started', onClick: () => console.log('Get Started clicked') }, { text: 'Learn More', href: 'about' }]} 
  />
</ThemeProvider>

hero.name: HeroCarouselLogo
hero.description: Full-screen hero section with auto-playing carousel background, large SVG text logo at bottom, description and button row above, with progress bars and linear gradient blur overlay.
hero.details: Use for brand-focused landing pages with multiple background images/videos that auto-rotate. Combines auto-playing carousel with logo layout. Features full viewport height with carousel of background media slides (image or video), auto-advancing with customizable delay (default 3000ms). Linear gradient blur overlay at bottom (75vh height) for improved logo visibility. Large responsive SVG text logo fills the width below content. Above logo is horizontal row with description text on left and up to 2 buttons on right (stacked vertically on mobile). Progress bars at bottom show carousel progress with animated fill. Logo height adjusts responsively (1.1x on mobile, 0.8x on desktop). Users can click progress bars to navigate slides directly.

description.example: Create stunning, responsive websites with our comprehensive component library

slides.note: Array of CarouselSlide objects. Each slide can have imageSrc, videoSrc, imageAlt, videoAriaLabel. Video takes precedence over image if both provided in a slide.

showDimOverlay.note: Adds semi-transparent dark overlay (bg-background/20) over background media for improved text and logo contrast

structure.href: string - Link destination (optional). External URLs (https://, http://, www.) open in new tab. Internal values (e.g., 'about', 'contact') scroll to #about, #contact sections
structure.props: Partial<ButtonPropsForVariant> - Additional button props like className, textClassName (optional)

buttonRules.note: Buttons are required (cannot be empty array). Button variant is controlled by ThemeProvider's defaultButtonVariant. Border radius is controlled by ThemeProvider's borderRadius (options: 'sharp', 'rounded', 'soft', 'pill'). All sections should be wrapped in a single ThemeProvider at the app/page level to maintain consistent styling across the entire site.

propsSchema.slides: CarouselSlide[] - Array of { imageSrc?: string, videoSrc?: string, imageAlt?: string, videoAriaLabel?: string }

hero.usage:
<ThemeProvider defaultButtonVariant="icon-arrow" defaultTextAnimation="entrance-slide" borderRadius="pill">
  <HeroCarouselLogo 
    logoText="WEBILD" 
    description="Create stunning, responsive websites with our comprehensive component library" 
    buttons={[{ text: 'Get Started', href: 'https://github.com' }, { text: 'Learn More', href: 'about' }]} 
    slides={[{ imageSrc: '/slide1.jpg', imageAlt: 'Slide 1' }, { imageSrc: '/slide2.jpg', imageAlt: 'Slide 2' }, { imageSrc: '/slide3.jpg', imageAlt: 'Slide 3' }]}
    autoplayDelay={5000}
  />
</ThemeProvider>

hero.name: HeroChatPrompt
hero.description: Full-viewport hero section with centered text content, decorative prompt input box, and feature tags below. Designed for AI/chat product landing pages.
hero.details: Use for AI product, chatbot, or conversation-focused landing pages. Features centered title and description with TextBox animations, optional tag with icon. Below text is a decorative card containing non-functional prompt text and send button icon (ArrowUp, hardcoded). At bottom are feature tags displayed as small cards in a flex-wrap layout, each with required icon and label. All elements centered and responsive. Prompt box uses w-full md:w-50, feature tags container also w-full md:w-50.

description.example: Experience the power of AI-driven conversations

structure.label: string - Feature tag text (required)
structure.icon: LucideIcon - Icon for tag (required, not optional)

featureTagRules.note: Feature tags array is required. Each tag must have an icon (not optional). Tags displayed as small cards with icon and label.

propsSchema.title: string
propsSchema.featureTags: FeatureTag[] - Array of { id: string, label: string, icon: LucideIcon }

hero.usage:
<ThemeProvider defaultButtonVariant="hover-magnetic" defaultTextAnimation="reveal-blur" borderRadius="rounded">
  <HeroChatPrompt 
    title="Chat with Intelligence" 
    description="Experience the power of AI-driven conversations" 
    tag="AI Assistant" 
    tagIcon={Sparkles}
    promptText="Ask me anything..."
    featureTags={[
      { id: '1', label: 'Lightning Fast', icon: Zap },
      { id: '2', label: 'Smart Responses', icon: Brain },
      { id: '3', label: 'Natural Conversation', icon: MessageSquare }
    ]}
  />
</ThemeProvider>

hero.name: HeroChatPromptFeatures
hero.description: Full-viewport hero with centered text, feature tags, prompt input, divider, and feature highlights grid. Enhanced version for showcasing AI product capabilities.
hero.details: Use for AI/SaaS landing pages that need to highlight both quick features and detailed capabilities. Features centered title/description with optional tag, feature tags (small chips with icons) displayed above prompt box, decorative prompt input card with send button, horizontal divider line, and 2-4 feature highlights below in responsive grid. Feature highlights include icon, title, and subtitle in card layout. Grid adapts: 2 items = 2 cols, 3 items = 3 cols, 4 items = 2x2 grid. All centered with w-50 max width on desktop.

title.example: Jump into the future of sales with Human

description.example: Supercharge your sales team with intelligent AI automation for faster growth

featureTagRules.note: Feature tags displayed as small chips above prompt box. Array is required.

examples: { id: '1', icon: Brain, title: 'Automated sales Insights', subtitle: 'Eliminate repetitive tasks' }
{ id: '2', icon: TrendingUp, title: 'Predictive lead Scoring', subtitle: 'Machine learning to forecast trends' }
featureHighlightRules.note: 2 items: 2-column grid. 3 items: 3-column grid. 4 items: 2x2 grid. Each highlight is a card with icon, title, and subtitle.

propsSchema.title: string
propsSchema.featureTags: FeatureTag[] - Array of { id: string, label: string, icon: LucideIcon }
propsSchema.featureHighlights: FeatureHighlight[] - Array of { id: string, icon: LucideIcon, title: string, subtitle: string }

hero.usage: <HeroChatPromptFeatures title="Jump into the future of sales" description="Supercharge your sales team with AI automation" tag="NEW" promptText="Generate insights now..." featureTags={[{ id: '1', label: 'Thinking', icon: Brain }]} featureHighlights={[{ id: '1', icon: Brain, title: 'Automated sales Insights', subtitle: 'Eliminate repetitive tasks' }, { id: '2', icon: TrendingUp, title: 'Predictive lead Scoring', subtitle: 'Machine learning to forecast' }]} />

hero.name: HeroEmailSignup
hero.description: Full-viewport hero section with centered text content and email signup form. Designed for newsletter signups, lead capture, and email collection.
hero.details: Use for newsletter signups, waitlist pages, or lead capture landing pages. Features centered title and description with TextBox animations, optional tag with icon. Below text is a functional EmailSignupForm component in a card with input field and submit button. Form uses w-full md:w-30 container width. Includes onSubmit callback for email handling. Form has built-in validation and responsive design (stacked on mobile, horizontal on desktop).

description.example: Join thousands of subscribers who get the latest insights

hero.usage:
<ThemeProvider defaultButtonVariant="hover-magnetic" defaultTextAnimation="reveal-blur" borderRadius="rounded">
  <HeroEmailSignup 
    title="Stay Updated" 
    description="Join thousands of subscribers who get the latest insights" 
    tag="Newsletter" 
    tagIcon={Mail}
    inputPlaceholder="Enter your email address"
    buttonText="Subscribe"
    onSubmit={(email) => console.log('Email:', email)}
  />
</ThemeProvider>

hero.name: HeroWaitlist
hero.description: Full-viewport hero section with centered text content and customizable multi-field waitlist form. Designed for product launches, beta signups, and flexible data collection.
hero.details: Use for product launch pages, beta signups, or waitlist campaigns requiring multiple fields. Features centered title and description with TextBox animations, optional tag with icon. Below text is a flexible WaitlistForm component that accepts any number of configurable input fields via the fields array. Fields are arranged horizontally on desktop, stacked on mobile. Full-width submit button below inputs. Form uses w-full md:w-40 container width. Includes onSubmit callback that returns all field data as a key-value object. Form has built-in validation for required fields. Default fields are email and username, but can be customized to collect any data (name, company, phone, etc.).

description.example: Be the first to know when we launch

fieldsRules.default: [{ name: 'email', type: 'email', placeholder: 'Your email', ariaLabel: 'Email address', required: true }, { name: 'username', type: 'text', placeholder: 'Telegram username', ariaLabel: 'Username', required: true }]

structure.name: string - Field identifier used as key in onSubmit data (required)
structure.type: string - HTML input type: 'text', 'email', 'tel', etc. (optional, default: 'text')
structure.placeholder: string - Placeholder text displayed in input (optional)
structure.ariaLabel: string - Accessibility label (optional, defaults to placeholder)
structure.required: boolean - Whether field is required (optional, default: true)

examples: { name: 'email', type: 'email', placeholder: 'Your email', required: true }
{ name: 'phone', type: 'tel', placeholder: 'Phone number', required: false }
fieldsRules.note: Fields array is optional. Defaults to email and username fields. Can be customized to collect any data. onSubmit returns object with field names as keys.

propsSchema.title: string
propsSchema.fields?: FormField[] - Array of { name: string, type?: string, placeholder?: string, ariaLabel?: string, required?: boolean }. Default: [email, username] fields
propsSchema.onSubmit?: (data: Record<string, string>) => void - Receives object with field names as keys

hero.usage:
<ThemeProvider defaultButtonVariant="hover-magnetic" defaultTextAnimation="reveal-blur" borderRadius="rounded">
  <HeroWaitlist 
    title="Join the Waitlist" 
    description="Be the first to know when we launch" 
    tag="Coming Soon" 
    tagIcon={Users}
    fields={[
      { name: 'email', type: 'email', placeholder: 'Your email', ariaLabel: 'Email address', required: true },
      { name: 'username', type: 'text', placeholder: 'Telegram username', ariaLabel: 'Username', required: true }
    ]}
    buttonText="Join waitlist"
    onSubmit={(data) => console.log('Waitlist:', data)}
  />
</ThemeProvider>

hero.name: HeroMetrics
hero.description: Full-viewport hero with centered text and KPI metrics at bottom. Ideal for SaaS/startup landing pages showcasing key statistics.
hero.details: Use for landing pages that need to highlight company metrics, user statistics, or key performance indicators. Features centered title, description, optional tag with icon, and action buttons. Bottom section displays metrics with label text on left and 2-3 metric cards on right in responsive grid. Layout uses flexbox with equal spacing top and bottom of TextBox. Metrics grid adapts: 2 items = 2 cols, 3 items = 3 cols (third item spans full width on mobile). Border-top separates metrics from content.

title.example: Run your startup in the cloud, effortlessly

description.example: Comprehensive platform for initiating, growing, and overseeing contemporary startups

metricsLabel.example: Trusted by forward-thinking VCs, accelerators, and early-stage startups

metricRules.note: Grid layout: 2 items = 2 columns, 3 items = 3 columns (third item full width on mobile). Each metric displays in a card.

buttonRules.note: Button variant controlled by ThemeProvider's defaultButtonVariant.

propsSchema.title: string
propsSchema.metrics: Metric[] - Array of { id: string, value: string, label: string }

hero.usage: <HeroMetrics title="Run your startup in the cloud" description="Comprehensive platform for startups" tag="Secure & VC-trusted" metricsLabel="Trusted by forward-thinking VCs" metrics={[{ id: '1', value: '200+', label: 'Founders Onboarded' }, { id: '2', value: '12k+', label: 'Investors Connected' }]} buttons={[{ text: 'Start for free', href: '#' }]} />

hero.name: HeroBillboardRotatedCarousel
hero.description: Hero section with centered text content and angled/rotated carousel below. Features auto-playing carousel with scaled and rotated side cards.
hero.details: Use for product showcases, portfolios, or visual-heavy landing pages. Features centered title, description, optional tag with icon, and action buttons via TextBox component. Below is an AngledCarousel showing rotated preview cards on sides (88% scale, 2deg rotation) with center card at full scale. Carousel auto-advances every 4 seconds. Side cards have backdrop blur overlay. Requires minimum 6 carousel items to avoid duplicate key warnings (carousel shows 5 positions: -2, -1, 0, 1, 2). Uses full viewport height with custom spacing.

description.example: Experience the power of seamless collaboration and productivity tools designed for modern teams

buttonRules.note: Button variant controlled by ThemeProvider's defaultButtonVariant. All sections should be wrapped in a single ThemeProvider at the app/page level.

structure.videoSrc: string - Video URL (optional, takes precedence over imageSrc)

carouselItemRules.note: Minimum 6 items required to prevent duplicate keys. Carousel displays 5 positions simultaneously (-2, -1, 0, 1, 2). Each item should have either imageSrc or videoSrc. Uses MediaContent component for rendering.

propsSchema.title: string
propsSchema.carouselItems: CarouselItem[] - Array of { id: string, imageSrc?: string, videoSrc?: string, imageAlt?: string, videoAriaLabel?: string } (minimum 6 items)

hero.usage:
<ThemeProvider defaultButtonVariant="hover-bubble" defaultTextAnimation="entrance-slide" borderRadius="pill">
  <HeroBillboardRotatedCarousel 
    title="Transform Your Workflow" 
    description="Experience seamless collaboration and productivity" 
    tag="New Release" 
    tagIcon={Sparkles}
    buttons={[{ text: 'Get Started' }, { text: 'Learn More' }]}
    carouselItems={[
      { id: '1', imageSrc: '/image1.jpg', imageAlt: 'Product 1' },
      { id: '2', imageSrc: '/image2.jpg', imageAlt: 'Product 2' },
      { id: '3', imageSrc: '/image3.jpg', imageAlt: 'Product 3' },
      { id: '4', imageSrc: '/image4.jpg', imageAlt: 'Product 4' },
      { id: '5', imageSrc: '/image5.jpg', imageAlt: 'Product 5' },
      { id: '6', imageSrc: '/image6.jpg', imageAlt: 'Product 6' }
    ]}
    autoPlay={true}
    autoPlayInterval={4000}
  />
</ThemeProvider>

about.name: SplitAbout
about.description: Split-layout about section with bullet points on one side and image/video on the other.
about.details: Use for about sections showcasing features or benefits with visual support. Features responsive split layout with configurable image position (left/right), bullet points with optional icons, title, and description. Image side takes 60% width on desktop (70% on 2xl), text takes 40% (30% on 2xl). Both sides have card styling with theme border radius.

description.example: Learn more about our mission, values, and what drives us forward

buttonRules.note: Button variant controlled by ThemeProvider's defaultButtonVariant. All sections should be wrapped in a single ThemeProvider at the app/page level.

structure.title: string - Bullet point heading (required)
structure.icon: LucideIcon - Optional icon displayed above title

bulletPointRules.note: Bullet points are separated by horizontal dividers. Border radius controlled by ThemeProvider's borderRadius (options: 'sharp', 'rounded', 'soft', 'pill'). All sections should be wrapped in a single ThemeProvider at the app/page level.

imageSrc.note: Supports external URLs

videoSrc.note: Takes precedence over imageSrc if both provided

imageAlt.note: Empty string marks image as decorative (aria-hidden)

propsSchema.title: string
propsSchema.titleSegments?: TitleSegment[] - Array of { type: 'text', content: string } | { type: 'image', src: string, alt?: string } for inline images in title
propsSchema.bulletPoints: Array<{ title: string, description: string, icon?: LucideIcon }>
propsSchema.textboxLayout: 'default' | 'split' | 'split-actions' | 'split-description' | 'inline-image' (required - 'inline-image' uses titleSegments for rich text with images)
propsSchema.titleImageWrapperClassName?: string - For styling image wrapper in inline-image layout
propsSchema.titleImageClassName?: string - For styling images in inline-image layout

about.usage:
// Wrap in ThemeProvider
<ThemeProvider defaultButtonVariant="text-stagger" defaultTextAnimation="entrance-slide" borderRadius="rounded" background="aurora" cardStyle="glass-elevated" primaryButtonStyle="gradient" secondaryButtonStyle="glass">
  <SplitAbout title="About Us" description="Learn more about our mission, values, and what drives us forward" textboxLayout="default" useInvertedBackground={"noInvert"} bulletPoints={[{ title: 'Innovation', description: 'We push boundaries', icon: Lightbulb }, { title: 'Quality', description: 'Excellence in every detail' }]} imageSrc="/about.jpg" />
</ThemeProvider>

about.name: TextSplitAbout
about.description: Split-layout about section with large heading on left and multiple description paragraphs with optional buttons on right.
about.details: Use for about sections with prominent messaging and optional CTA. Features responsive split layout with large animated heading (7xl) on left, multiple description paragraphs with optional buttons on right. Each description text animates independently. Supports up to 2 buttons with primary/secondary styling, optional border separator below content. Button variant controlled by ThemeProvider, text animations use theme defaults.

example: We're a team passionate about creating exceptional digital experiences
Our mission is to empower designers and developers
description.note: Each description paragraph should be 10-300 characters

buttonRules.note: Button variant controlled by ThemeProvider's defaultButtonVariant. Border radius controlled by ThemeProvider's borderRadius. All sections should be wrapped in a single ThemeProvider at the app/page level.

propsSchema.title: string
propsSchema.buttons?: Array<{ text: string, onClick?: () => void, href?: string, props?: Partial<ButtonPropsForVariant<CTAButtonVariant>> }>

about.usage:
// Wrap in ThemeProvider
<ThemeProvider defaultButtonVariant="shift-hover" defaultTextAnimation="entrance-slide" borderRadius="rounded" background="aurora" cardStyle="glass-elevated" primaryButtonStyle="gradient" secondaryButtonStyle="glass">
  <TextSplitAbout title="About Us" description={["We create amazing experiences", "Our mission is to empower teams"]} showBorder={true} useInvertedBackground={"noInvert"} buttons={[{ text: 'Learn More', href: 'about' }]} />
</ThemeProvider>

about.name: TextAbout
about.description: Centered about section with large animated text and optional buttons below.
about.details: Use for simple, impactful about statements. Features centered large text (2xl on mobile, 5xl on desktop) with TextAnimation using words-trigger variant, and up to 2 optional CTA buttons with primary/secondary styling. Button variant controlled by ThemeProvider, text animations use theme defaults.

title.example: We build products that empower teams to create exceptional digital experiences

buttonRules.note: Button variant controlled by ThemeProvider's defaultButtonVariant. Border radius controlled by ThemeProvider's borderRadius. All sections should be wrapped in a single ThemeProvider at the app/page level.

propsSchema.title: string
propsSchema.buttons?: Array<{ text: string, onClick?: () => void, href?: string, props?: Partial<ButtonPropsForVariant<CTAButtonVariant>> }>

about.usage:
// Wrap in ThemeProvider
<ThemeProvider defaultButtonVariant="icon-arrow" defaultTextAnimation="reveal-blur" borderRadius="soft" background="aurora" cardStyle="glass-elevated" primaryButtonStyle="gradient" secondaryButtonStyle="glass">
  <TextAbout title="We create exceptional digital experiences" useInvertedBackground={"noInvert"} buttons={[{ text: 'Get Started', href: 'https://example.com' }, { text: 'Learn More', href: 'about' }]} />
</ThemeProvider>

about.name: InlineImageSplitTextAbout
about.description: About section with dynamic heading composed of alternating text and inline image segments.
about.details: Use for impactful about statements with visual branding elements. Heading is composed of an array of segments that can be text or images in any order. Images are styled with primary-button styling and alternate rotation (-rotate-12, rotate-12) for dynamic visual effect. Images are square (1.1em height) with aspect-square ratio, aligned middle with horizontal margins. Up to 2 optional CTA buttons with primary/secondary styling. Button variant controlled by ThemeProvider.

heading[].content.note: Each text segment in the heading array

heading[].src.note: Supports local paths and external URLs. External URLs are rendered with unoptimized flag.

heading[].alt.note: Optional alt text for images. Omit or use empty string for decorative images (aria-hidden=true when empty).

headingRules.note: heading array can contain any number of text and image segments in any order. Images automatically alternate rotation direction (1st: -rotate-12, 2nd: rotate-12, etc.).

buttonRules.note: Button variant controlled by ThemeProvider's defaultButtonVariant. Border radius controlled by ThemeProvider's borderRadius.

propsSchema.heading: Array<{ type: 'text'; content: string } | { type: 'image'; src: string; alt?: string }>
propsSchema.buttons?: Array<{ text: string, onClick?: () => void, href?: string, props?: Partial<ButtonPropsForVariant<CTAButtonVariant>> }>

about.usage:
// Wrap in ThemeProvider
<ThemeProvider defaultButtonVariant="text-stagger" defaultTextAnimation="entrance-slide" borderRadius="rounded" background="aurora" cardStyle="glass-elevated" primaryButtonStyle="gradient" secondaryButtonStyle="glass">
  <InlineImageSplitTextAbout heading={[{ type: 'text', content: 'Building the future with' }, { type: 'image', src: '/brand/logo.png', alt: 'Company logo' }, { type: 'text', content: 'innovative solutions' }]} useInvertedBackground={"noInvert"} buttons={[{ text: 'Get Started', href: '/signup' }, { text: 'Learn More', href: '/about' }]} />
</ThemeProvider>

about.name: AboutMetric
about.description: About section with centered animated title and metric cards in a responsive grid.
about.details: Use for showcasing company metrics, achievements, and statistics with visual impact. Features centered large animated title (2xl on mobile, 5xl on desktop) using words-trigger variant with theme's default text animation. Displays 2-4 metric cards in a responsive grid (1 column mobile, 2-4 columns desktop based on metric count). Each card includes an icon in a primary-button styled container, metric label, and large value text (6xl). Cards have fixed height (h-fit with py-8 md:py-10), rounded-theme-capped borders, and centered content. Perfect for highlighting key business achievements, statistics, or milestones.

title.example: At Berco Inc. we redefine innovation by empowering businesses to reach their full potential

structure.label: string - Descriptive label for the metric (required, e.g., 'Conversions', 'Partnered Brands')
structure.value: string - Metric value to display (required, e.g., '7,000+', '2018', '30+', '100M+')

metricRules.note: Provide 2-4 metrics for optimal layout. Grid automatically adjusts columns based on metric count (2 metrics = 2 cols, 3 metrics = 3 cols, 4 metrics = 4 cols). Import icons from lucide-react.

propsSchema.title: string
propsSchema.metrics: Array<{ icon: LucideIcon, label: string, value: string }>

about.name: AboutFeature
about.description: About section with centered animated title and feature cards in a responsive grid.
about.details: Use for showcasing company features, values, or services with visual impact. Features centered large animated title (2xl on mobile, 5xl on desktop) using words-trigger variant with theme's default text animation. Displays 2-4 feature cards in a responsive grid (1 column mobile, 2-4 columns desktop based on feature count). Each card includes an icon in a primary-button styled container at the top, feature title (h3), and description below. Cards have fixed responsive heights (h-50 on mobile, md:h-60, 2xl:h-70), rounded-theme-capped borders, and card styling. Perfect for highlighting key features, core values, or service offerings.

title.example: We believe in creating experiences that inspire, empower, and transform. Our team is dedicated to building solutions that make a real difference.

structure.title: string - Feature title/heading (required, e.g., 'Innovation First', 'Team Collaboration')
structure.description: string - Feature description explaining the benefit or value (required)

featureRules.note: Provide 2-4 features for optimal layout. Grid automatically adjusts columns based on feature count (2 features = 2 cols, 3 features = 3 cols, 4 features = 4 cols). Import icons from lucide-react.

propsSchema.title: string
propsSchema.features: Array<{ icon: LucideIcon, title: string, description: string }>

about.name: SplitAboutMetric
about.description: Split-layout about section with title on left, description and metrics on right.
about.details: Use for showcasing company metrics in a professional split layout. Features large animated title (7xl) on the left column (50% width), and description text with metrics on the right column (50% width). Description uses large text (base on mobile, 2xl on desktop) with theme's default text animation. Divider separates description from metrics. Exactly 2 metrics displayed in a grid with large centered values (9xl) and labels below. Values and labels use truncate for single-line display. Follows TextSplitAbout pattern for consistent split-section layouts. Optional bottom border with showBorder prop.

description.example: Shivalik developers are on a quest to build a legacy of timeless elegance.
description.note: Array of description strings. Each string is rendered with text animation.

structure.label: string - Descriptive label for the metric (required, single line, uses truncate)
structure.value: string - Metric value to display (required, single line, uses truncate, e.g., '75+', '15M+')

metricRules.note: Must provide exactly 2 metrics. Values and labels are displayed centered with truncate to ensure single-line display. No icons supported.

propsSchema.title: string
propsSchema.metrics: [{ label: string, value: string }, { label: string, value: string }]

about.name: SplitAboutFeatures
about.description: Split-layout about section with title on left, flexible 2-column grid of icon-based feature cards on right.
about.details: Use for highlighting key features or benefits in about sections. Layout: Title on left (w-1/2, text-7xl) → 2-column Grid of Feature Cards on right (w-1/2, grid-cols-2, gap-6). Each feature card has card styling with rounded-theme-capped, displays icon in primary-button square container (h-8, aspect-square, rounded-theme), and feature text (p-8 padding). Icon container uses h-45/100 w-45/100 sizing with text-background color. Text uses shouldUseInvertedText logic. Supports flexible array of 2-8 features - when odd count (3, 5, 7), last item spans full width (col-span-2). Optional bottom border. Best for showcasing company values, product benefits, or service highlights with visual icons.

featureRules.note: Flexible array of 2-8 features. Grid is 2 columns - odd counts (3, 5, 7) make last item span full width. Each card has icon in primary-button container and text with leading-tight.

propsSchema.title: string
propsSchema.features: Array<{ text: string, icon: LucideIcon }> (2-8 items)

about.usage: <SplitAboutFeatures title="About" features={[{ text: 'Lightning-fast performance that scales with your needs', icon: Zap }, { text: 'Enterprise-grade security protecting your data', icon: Shield }, { text: 'Built for teams of all sizes and structures', icon: Users }, { text: 'Focused on achieving your business goals', icon: Target }]} useInvertedBackground={"noInvert"} />

about.name: TagAbout
about.description: About section with inline tag label and large animated description text.
about.details: Use for showcasing company statements, mission, or values with a category label. Features a small inline tag label (base on mobile, xl on desktop) followed by large animated description text (2xl on mobile, 5xl on desktop) that flows inline. Tag uses accent color with reduced opacity. Description uses theme's default text animation with words-trigger variant. Both tag and description flow inline, creating a cohesive visual statement. Perfect for 'Why us', 'Our mission', 'About us' sections with categorized content.

description.example: At DialedWeb, we embody the startup mindset — dynamic, innovative, and hungry to make a difference.
description.note: Main description text that flows inline after the tag

about.usage:
// Wrap in ThemeProvider

<ThemeProvider defaultButtonVariant="text-stagger" defaultTextAnimation="entrance-slide" borderRadius="rounded" contentWidth="medium" sizing="medium" background="aurora" cardStyle="glass-elevated" primaryButtonStyle="gradient" secondaryButtonStyle="glass">
  <TagAbout 
    tag="Why us" 
    description="At DialedWeb, we embody the startup mindset — dynamic, innovative, and hungry to make a difference. We don't just create amazing works; we partner with our clients to revolutionize their industries through groundbreaking digital experiences." 
    useInvertedBackground={"noInvert"}
  />
</ThemeProvider>

about.name: AboutPhoneTimeline
about.description: About section with dual phone mockups featuring scroll-triggered animations and centered content.
about.details: Use for showcasing mobile app features or product previews in about sections. Features dual phone frames (left and right) that animate on scroll using GSAP ScrollTrigger, with centered content area containing tag, animated title, description, and optional buttons. On desktop, phones are sticky while content scrolls, creating an immersive parallax effect. On mobile, layout stacks vertically with content above phone mockups. Content uses theme's default text animations with trigger variant for scroll-based reveals. Perfect for 'About us', 'Our mission', or 'What we do' sections highlighting mobile-first products or apps.

description.example: We believe in creating experiences that inspire, empower, and transform.

tag.note: Tag is required for this component

buttonRules.note: Button variant controlled by ThemeProvider's defaultButtonVariant. All sections should be wrapped in a single ThemeProvider at the app/page level.

phoneOne.structure: ({ imageSrc: string, imageAlt?: string } | { videoSrc: string, videoAriaLabel?: string })
phoneOne.note: Each phone requires either imageSrc OR videoSrc (discriminated union). Use imageSrc for static mockups, videoSrc for animated demos.

phoneTwo.structure: ({ imageSrc: string, imageAlt?: string } | { videoSrc: string, videoAriaLabel?: string })
phoneTwo.note: Each phone requires either imageSrc OR videoSrc (discriminated union). Use imageSrc for static mockups, videoSrc for animated demos.

imageAlt.note: Defaults to '{title} - Image 1/2' if not provided

videoAriaLabel.example: App demo video showing onboarding flow
videoAriaLabel.note: Defaults to '{title} - Video 1/2' if not provided

propsSchema.title: string
propsSchema.titleSegments?: TitleSegment[] - Array for inline images in title
propsSchema.textboxLayout: 'default' | 'split' | 'split-actions' | 'split-description' | 'inline-image' (required)
propsSchema.phoneOne: ({ imageSrc: string, imageAlt?: string } | { videoSrc: string, videoAriaLabel?: string })
propsSchema.phoneTwo: ({ imageSrc: string, imageAlt?: string } | { videoSrc: string, videoAriaLabel?: string })

about.name: MediaAbout
about.description: Full-width media about section with centered CTA button(s) overlaid on image or video.
about.details: Use for impactful visual-first about sections where the media is the primary focus with minimal text. Features full-width media (image or video) in aspect-video ratio with content-width constraint, rounded corners (theme-capped), and 1-2 centered CTA buttons overlaid using absolute positioning. Buttons follow primary/secondary styling based on index (first button = primary, second = secondary) via getButtonProps utility. Perfect for hero-like about sections, product showcases, or call-to-action moments where visual impact is key. Section uses standard py-20 padding with useInvertedBackground support for section background (not affecting overlay buttons).

imageSrc.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc should be provided. Image is recommended for static visuals.

videoSrc.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc should be provided. Video is recommended for motion content.

imageAlt.note: Alt text for image. Defaults to empty string (decorative).

videoAriaLabel.note: ARIA label for video accessibility.

buttonRules.note: Buttons are centered and overlaid on media. First button is primary, second is secondary. Button variant controlled by ThemeProvider's defaultButtonVariant.

about.usage: <MediaAbout imageSrc="/about-hero.jpg" imageAlt="Our team" buttons={[{ text: 'Shop Now', href: '/shop' }]} useInvertedBackground={"noInvert"} />

about.name: ParallaxAbout
about.description: Full-width parallax about section with fixed media background and centered CTA button(s) using clip-path reveal effect.
about.details: Use for immersive, full-bleed parallax experiences where the media stays fixed while content scrolls over it. Features fixed positioning with clip-path polygon to contain the parallax effect within the section bounds. Media (image or video) is fixed to viewport and stays in place during scroll, creating a dramatic parallax effect. Section height is h-svh (screen viewport height). Buttons are positioned relatively with z-10, centered vertically and horizontally. Supports 1-2 CTA buttons following primary/secondary styling pattern via getButtonProps. Perfect for impactful hero-like about sections, brand showcases, or immersive storytelling moments. The clip-path technique ensures the fixed background only appears within the section boundaries, not bleeding into other content. Media has rounded-none! to override theme border radius for full-bleed effect.

imageSrc.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc should be provided. Image recommended for static parallax backgrounds.

videoSrc.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc should be provided. Video creates dynamic parallax motion.

imageAlt.note: Alt text for image. Defaults to empty string (decorative background).

videoAriaLabel.note: ARIA label for video accessibility.

buttonRules.note: Buttons are centered with z-10 positioning over parallax background. First button is primary, second is secondary. Button variant controlled by ThemeProvider's defaultButtonVariant.

technicalNotes.parallaxTechnique: Uses fixed positioning with clip-path: polygon(0% 0, 100% 0%, 100% 100%, 0 100%) to create contained parallax effect
technicalNotes.height: Section is h-svh (100svh) for full screen viewport height
technicalNotes.zIndex: Section is z-0, buttons are z-10 to appear above fixed background
technicalNotes.scrollBehavior: Fixed media stays in place while page scrolls, buttons scroll normally

about.usage: <ParallaxAbout imageSrc="/parallax-hero.jpg" imageAlt="Brand background" buttons={[{ text: 'Discover More', href: '/about' }]} />

about.name: MediaSplitAbout
about.description: Split-layout about section with text card on one side and media card on the other in 50/50 grid.
about.details: Use for about sections where text content and visual media deserve equal emphasis. Features responsive 50/50 grid layout (stacked on mobile). Content card contains title (4xl-5xl), description (base-lg), and optional CTA buttons at bottom using flex justify-between. Media card contains image or video with card styling and rounded corners. Image position is configurable (left or right, default: right). Both cards have card styling with theme border radius. Text colors adapt based on useInvertedBackground and cardStyle using shouldUseInvertedText utility. Supports 1-2 CTA buttons following primary/secondary pattern. Perfect for 'About us', 'Our story', 'Team intro' sections where you want balanced text and visual content with clear call-to-action. Grid uses gap-6 between cards and w-content-width constraint.

description.example: We're a global team of designers and craftspeople dedicated to creating timeless pieces that blend style with functionality.

imageSrc.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc should be provided for optimal display.

videoSrc.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc should be provided for optimal display.

imageAlt.note: Alt text for image.

videoAriaLabel.note: ARIA label for video accessibility.

imagePosition.note: Position of media card relative to content card.

buttonRules.note: Buttons appear at bottom of content card. First button is primary, second is secondary. Button variant controlled by ThemeProvider's defaultButtonVariant.

about.usage: <MediaSplitAbout title="Worldwide Team" description="We're a global team of designers and craftspeople dedicated to creating timeless pieces." imageSrc="/team-photo.jpg" imageAlt="Our team" buttons={[{ text: 'Shop Now', href: '/shop' }]} imagePosition="right" useInvertedBackground={"noInvert"} />

about.name: MediaGridAbout
about.description: Split-layout about section with text card on one side and media grid card on the other in 50/50 grid.
about.details: Use for showcasing multiple images/videos alongside descriptive content. Layout: 50/50 grid with content card (title + description) and media grid card. Media grid supports 1-6 items with responsive layouts: 1-2 items use single column, 3-6 items use 2-column grid. For 3 or 5 items, the last item spans full width (col-span-2). Media position is configurable (left or right, default: right). Both cards use card styling with rounded-theme-capped. Content card has p-6 md:p-10 padding with flex column layout. Media card has p-6 padding with gap-6 grid. Text colors adapt using shouldUseInvertedText based on useInvertedBackground and cardStyle. Recommended to use 6 media items for best visual balance. Perfect for team showcases, portfolio grids, product galleries, or visual storytelling sections.

title.example: We're a global team of designers and craftspeople

description.example: Our approach combines traditional techniques with modern aesthetics to deliver products that stand the test of time.

structure.imageSrc: string - Image source path (optional if videoSrc provided)
structure.videoSrc: string - Video source path (optional if imageSrc provided)

mediaRules.note: Use 6 items for optimal visual balance. Each media item is contained with overflow-hidden and absolute positioning for proper aspect ratio handling.

about.usage: <MediaGridAbout title="We're a global team of designers and craftspeople" description="Our approach combines traditional techniques with modern aesthetics to deliver products that stand the test of time. We're dedicated to creating timeless pieces that blend style with functionality." mediaItems={[{ imageSrc: '/team1.jpg', imageAlt: 'Team collaboration' }, { imageSrc: '/team2.jpg', imageAlt: 'Design process' }, { imageSrc: '/team3.jpg', imageAlt: 'Product showcase' }, { imageSrc: '/team4.jpg', imageAlt: 'Workshop' }, { imageSrc: '/team5.jpg', imageAlt: 'Materials' }, { imageSrc: '/team6.jpg', imageAlt: 'Final product' }]} imagePosition="right" useInvertedBackground="noInvert" />

about.name: SplitAboutCards
about.description: Split-layout about section with TextBox on left (1/3) and exactly 2 feature cards in grid on right (2/3).
about.details: Use for highlighting key offerings, pricing, or features with prominent labels. Layout: TextBox on left (w-1/3, default layout with optional tag, title, description, buttons)  Fixed 2-card Grid on right (w-2/3, md:grid-cols-2, gap-6). Each card displays title, description, and prominent label text at bottom (e.g., pricing, metric, or key value). Cards use card styling with rounded-theme-capped, p-6 padding, gap-10 between sections. Text colors adapt using shouldUseInvertedText logic. Component enforces exactly 2 feature cards via tuple type. Perfect for service tiers, pricing comparisons, dual feature highlights, or two-option showcases.

about.name: TagMediaSplitAbout
about.description: Split-layout about section with CardStackTextBox header, Tag component, and card/border variants for content and media.
about.details: Use for about sections with optional header and split content featuring prominent category tags. Layout: CardStackTextBox (optional header with title, description, tag, buttons)  2-column grid with content card (left/right) and media card. Content card includes Tag component with icon, title (4xl), description (base-lg), and optional CTA buttons. Supports two variants: 'card' (content has card styling with padding) and 'border' (removes card styling, adds vertical/horizontal divider lines). Text colors adapt based on variant: card uses shouldUseLightText, border uses useInvertedBackground directly. Border variant includes responsive dividers (horizontal on mobile, vertical on desktop with 3-column grid). Media position is configurable (left or right, default: right). Perfect for 'About us' sections with categorized content, team introductions with department labels, or service descriptions with visual context. Grid uses gap-6 on mobile, gap-10 on desktop for border variant.

feature.name: FeatureCardOne
feature.description: Adaptive feature section with image/video-based cards in customizable bento grid layouts or carousel.
feature.details: Use for visually-rich feature showcases with images or videos. Each card displays media (image/video), title, description, and optional button. Automatically switches between grid (1-4 items) and carousel (5+ items). For grid layouts, choose from 9 bento variants: uniform-all-items-equal, two-columns-alternating-heights, asymmetric-60-wide-40-narrow, three-columns-all-equal-width, four-items-2x2-equal-grid, one-large-right-three-stacked-left, items-top-row-full-width-bottom, full-width-top-items-bottom-row, one-large-left-three-stacked-right. Carousel offers auto-scroll or button controls (recommended: keep default buttons for better UX). Optional header with title, description, tag, and buttons. Header supports centered or split textbox layout (split: tag + title + description left, buttons right; split-actions: tag + title left, buttons only right; split-description: tag + title left, description only right).

Each card shows a numbered step badge, title, and description. The shared media area above cards displays images/videos that smoothly transition (opacity fade) as cards advance. Media uses aspect-square on mobile and aspect-video on desktop. Active and previous cards are fully visible (opacity-100), future cards are dimmed (opacity-50). Users can click any card to jump to that step. Grid adapts: 2 items = 2 columns, 3 items = 3 columns, 4+ items = 4 columns. Automatically loops back to first card. Optional header with title, description, tag, and buttons. Header supports centered or split textbox layout (split: tag + title + description left, buttons right; split-actions: tag + title left, buttons only right; split-description: tag + title left, description only right).

feature.name: FeatureCardNine
feature.description: Scroll-based timeline feature section with two animated phone frames and centered content.
feature.details: Use for mobile-first feature presentations with visual phone mockups. Creates a vertical scroll-based timeline where each feature takes up 100vh of height. Features are displayed with title and description in the center, flanked by two animated phone frames (left and right) that slide in and rotate on scroll. Phone frames use GSAP ScrollTrigger animations: start from off-screen with rotation (-200% left, 200% right with 45deg rotation), then animate to center position with subtle rotation tilt. Desktop phones are 20 (w-20) 2xl:25 (2xl:w-25) in width and 70vh in height. Mobile phones are 45 (w-45) in width and 100 (h-100) in height. Phones display as card with rounded-theme-capped and p-1 padding. Each phone can show either an image or video (discriminated union). Feature content displays in the center with large text (5xl md:6xl title, xl description). Section has py-20 spacing. Mobile layout stacks feature content above phone pairs vertically. Desktop layout uses sticky positioning for phones while content scrolls through. Best for 2-4 features to avoid excessive scroll height.

description.example: Everything you need to build amazing products
Connect your tools and workflows effortlessly. Our platform integrates with your existing systems.

feature.details: Use for process-oriented features, step-by-step workflows, or feature showcases with supporting details. Built on TimelineProcessFlow with vertical scroll-animated line. Each feature shows media (image/video in card with rounded-theme-capped p-4) on one side, and content (title + description + icon list) on opposite side. Layout alternates based on reverse prop. Desktop: Split 50/50 with media and content side-by-side. Mobile: Stacked vertical with timeline on right edge. Features numbered badge in center (desktop) or right edge (mobile) using primary-button styling. Icon list items have card-styled containers with bg-background. Supports all TimelineProcessFlow features including GSAP scroll-triggered line animation. Best for 3-5 features showcasing capabilities with supporting points.

feature.name: FeatureCardEleven
feature.description: Timeline-based feature section with alternating layout showing separate text and image cards with numbered steps.
feature.details: Use for process-oriented feature displays or step-by-step showcases. Layout: Optional TextBox Header → Vertical List of Alternating Features (text card + image card in separate boxes). Each feature has numbered badge, title, description in one card (aspect-square, w-1/2, card class, p-6 md:p-15), and media content in separate card (aspect-square, w-1/2). Image card styling controlled by usePrimaryButtonImage prop: false (default) = card class, true = primary-button class with p-15 padding. Alternates between left-right and right-left layout per item. Uses CardList with disableCardWrapper=true so each feature item's text and image boxes have their own card styling. Both cards are aspect-square on all breakpoints. Best for showcasing multi-step processes, workflows, or sequential features with strong visual emphasis on each step.

feature.name: FeatureCardTwelve
feature.description: List-based feature section with large label on left and content with bullet points on right.
feature.details: Use for feature comparisons, model/tier showcases, or product version displays (e.g., 'Opus 4.1', 'GPT-4', 'Claude 3'). Uses CardList with variant system for card or border layouts. Layout: Optional TextBox Header  Vertical Stack of Features. Each feature card has horizontal split (md breakpoint): Left side (50%): Large label text (5xl mobile / 6xl desktop). Right side (50%): Title + inline bullet list with accent-colored dots () + optional buttons (0-2). Card variant: Items wrapped in cards with full padding (p-6 md:p-15) and mobile divider line. Border variant: Items separated by accent divider lines with bottom padding (pb-6 md:pb-10), no mobile divider. Text colors conditional on variant: border uses useInvertedBackground directly, card uses shouldUseLightText. Supports 0-2 buttons per feature with automatic primary/secondary styling via getButtonProps. Best for pricing tiers, product versions, or feature breakdowns with clear labeling.

pricing.details: Use for showcasing pricing plans with detailed feature lists. Uses CardList with variant system for card or border layouts. Layout: Optional TextBox Header  Vertical Stack of Pricing Cards. Each card has horizontal split (md breakpoint): Left side (50%): Tag, Price with period, Description, and CTA Button. Right side (50%): Features title and checklist with checkmark icons. Card variant: Items wrapped in cards with full padding (p-6 md:p-15) and mobile divider line. Border variant: Items separated by accent divider lines with bottom padding (pb-6 md:pb-10), no mobile divider. Text colors conditional on variant: border uses useInvertedBackground directly, card uses shouldUseLightText. Best for service-based pricing, retainer plans, or subscription tiers where feature lists are important.

metric.name: MetricCardFour
metric.description: Horizontal timeline metric section with auto-advancing progress bars, icon badges, and shared media display.
metric.details: Use for icon-led metric displays with visual media context in a horizontal timeline layout. Displays 2-4 metric cards in a grid (2-4 columns on desktop, stacked on mobile) with auto-advancing progress bars that fill over 5 seconds. Each card shows an icon badge (primary-button, rounded-theme), title, and large value (7xl). The shared media area above cards displays images/videos that smoothly transition (opacity fade) as cards advance. Media uses aspect-square on mobile and aspect-video on desktop. Active and previous cards are fully visible (opacity-100), future cards are dimmed (opacity-50). Users can click any card to jump to that metric. Grid adapts: 2 items = 2 columns, 3 items = 3 columns, 4+ items = 4 columns. Automatically loops back to first card. Best for categorized statistics or KPIs that need visual identification with supporting media. Optional header with title, description, tag, and buttons.

team.name: TeamCardFour
team.description: Dual auto-scrolling marquee team section with horizontal team member cards moving in opposite directions.
team.details: Use for dynamic team displays with continuous scrolling. Layout: Optional CardStackTextBox Header → Dual Auto-Scrolling Marquees (Top & Bottom). Each team card shows h-60 aspect-square media on left with name (3xl font-medium) and role (xl) on right in horizontal flex layout. Top marquee moves in one direction (default: left), bottom marquee automatically moves opposite direction (right). Both marquees use same speed and display same team members in reversed order to avoid perfect alignment. Uses AutoCarousel with dualMarquee support for smooth infinite scrolling. Speed is customizable (default: 40px/s). Supports both image and video media. Best for team showcases, staff galleries, or company culture sections. Optional header with title, description, tag, and buttons.

team.name: TeamCardFive
team.description: Team section with overlapping portrait cards in responsive flex layout showing centered vertical cards with name and role.
team.details: Use for team member displays with overlapping card effect. Layout: Optional CardStackTextBox Header → Responsive Flex Grid with Overlap. Mobile: 2 items per row (w-55%, -mx-4% overlap). Desktop: Up to 4 items per row (w-28%, -mx-2% overlap) with flex-wrap for additional rows. Each card shows aspect-square media in card wrapper (p-2, rounded-theme) with centered name (2xl font-medium, truncate) and role (base size, 75% opacity, truncate) below. Supports both image and video media. Uses useCardAnimation hook for GSAP scroll animations with stagger effect. Best for creative team showcases, staff galleries with visual impact. Optional header with title, description, tag, and buttons.

team.description: Responsive team showcase with circular avatars, progressive center-based sizing, and decorative background circles.
team.details: Use for team showcases or social proof ('Trusted by 2M+ users'). Features horizontal row of circular avatars with progressive sizing from center outward (center largest, edges smallest). For even item counts, both middle avatars are largest. Responsive display: shows center 3 items on mobile (below 768px), up to 7 items on desktop. Mobile intelligently displays the center 3 from the full set. Decorative concentric circles in background with card styling, mask-fade-bottom effect, and opacity variations (25%, 50%, 75%). Title below avatars uses TextAnimation. Images wrapped in card styling with p-1 and rounded-theme. Uses resize detection for responsive behavior. Best for team galleries, user testimonials, or social proof sections. No grid/carousel - simple centered horizontal flex row.

itemRules.note: Shows center 3 items on mobile (below 768px), up to 7 items on desktop. Mobile displays center 3 from the full desktop set for visual consistency. Works best with 5-7 team members for balanced composition.

testimonial.details: Use for displaying customer testimonials in a clean, card-based layout. Layout: Circular Image/Icon → Name + Role → Testimonial Text. If imageSrc is provided, displays circular profile image; otherwise shows icon (defaults to Quote if not specified). Icon/image container uses primary-button styling with rounded-theme. All text stacked vertically with consistent spacing. All core fields required for visual consistency. Best for testimonial grids, review sections, or customer feedback displays. Automatically switches between grid (1-4 items) and carousel (5+ items). Optional header with title, description, tag, and buttons.

description.example: See what our customers have to say

testimonial.example: The attention to detail and commitment to excellence was outstanding throughout the entire project.

imageSrc.note: Optional image path for customer photo. If not provided, icon will be displayed instead.

imageAlt.note: Alt text for image (defaults to customer name if not provided)

icon.note: Optional Lucide icon to display when no image is provided. Defaults to Quote icon.

propsSchema.containerStyle: 'default' | 'card' (required - 'default': individual items have card styling with gaps, 'card': entire grid wrapped in primary-button container)
propsSchema.title: string
propsSchema.titleSegments?: TitleSegment[] - Array of { type: 'text', content: string } | { type: 'image', src: string, alt?: string } for inline images in title
propsSchema.textboxLayout: 'default' | 'split' | 'split-actions' | 'split-description' | 'inline-image' (required - 'inline-image' uses titleSegments for rich text with images)

propsSchema.textBoxTitleImageClassName?: string - For styling images in inline-image layout

Best for social proof sections, review grids, or customer feedback displays. Automatically switches between grid (1-4 items) and carousel (5+ items). testimonial.name: TestimonialCardFour
testimonial.description: Horizontal timeline testimonial section with auto-advancing progress bars, rating stars, and shared media display.
testimonial.details: Use for customer testimonials with visual media context in a horizontal timeline layout. Displays 2-4 testimonial cards in a grid (2-4 columns on desktop, stacked on mobile) with auto-advancing progress bars that fill over 5 seconds. Each card shows rating stars (filled with accent color), client name (2xl), role, and company. The shared media area above cards displays images/videos that smoothly transition (opacity fade) as cards advance. Media uses aspect-square on mobile and aspect-video on desktop. Active and previous cards are fully visible (opacity-100), future cards are dimmed (opacity-50). Users can click any card to jump to that testimonial. Grid adapts: 2 items = 2 columns, 3 items = 3 columns, 4+ items = 4 columns. Automatically loops back to first card. Best for photo-heavy testimonials or client showcases that need visual context. Optional header with title, description, tag, and buttons.

description.example: Hear from those who've experienced our work

name.note: Client name displayed as main heading

rating.note: Number of stars (1-5), displayed as filled accent-colored stars

imageSrc.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc required per testimonial (discriminated union)

videoSrc.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc required per testimonial (discriminated union)

imageAlt.note: Falls back to client name if not provided

videoAriaLabel.note: Falls back to client name if not provided

itemRules.note: Works best with 2-4 testimonials. Grid layout adapts based on item count.

testimonial.name: TestimonialCardFive
testimonial.description: Full-width carousel testimonial section with split card layout showing text content and square image side-by-side.
testimonial.details: Use for testimonials that need equal emphasis on visual content and testimonial text in a carousel format. Uses FullWidthCarousel layout where TextBox is in content-width but carousel spans full viewport width. Each card uses a 50/50 grid split on desktop (text left, square image right) and stacked on mobile (image on top with flex-col-reverse). Cards auto-advance every 5 seconds with clickable dot navigation below. Card content: Tag → Title (4xl, line-clamp-3) → Quote (lg, line-clamp-10) → Author info (avatar, name with role/company, date) on left; Square aspect-ratio media on right. Text uses p-6 md:p-10 padding with gap-10 vertical spacing. Best for high-quality visual testimonials where image and content deserve equal weight. Carousel items are w-70 with mr-6 spacing.

title.note: Testimonial headline shown at 4xl, truncated to 3 lines

quote.note: Full testimonial text shown at base/lg size, truncated to 10 lines

tag.note: Category or plan tag displayed at top of card

avatarSrc.note: Avatar image shown in TestimonialAuthor component (h-11 aspect-square)

imageSrc.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc should be provided for optimal display

videoSrc.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc should be provided for optimal display

imageAlt.note: Alt text for testimonial image

videoAriaLabel.note: ARIA label for testimonial video

itemRules.note: Works best with 5-6 testimonials. Auto-advances every 5 seconds with loop enabled.

testimonial.name: TestimonialCardSix
testimonial.description: Dual auto-scrolling marquee testimonial section with reversed testimonial cards moving in opposite directions.
testimonial.details: Use for dynamic testimonial displays with continuous scrolling. Layout: Optional TextBox Header → Dual Auto-Scrolling Marquees (Top & Bottom). Each testimonial card shows quote text (line-clamped to 2 lines for consistent heights) with TestimonialAuthor below (avatar/icon, name, handle). Top marquee moves in one direction (default: left), bottom marquee automatically moves opposite direction (right). Both marquees use same speed and display same testimonials in reversed order to avoid perfect alignment. Uses react-fast-marquee for smooth infinite scrolling. Supports quote icon or custom icon per testimonial. Speed is customizable (default: 30px/s). All core fields required for visual consistency. Best for social proof sections, client feedback showcases, or review displays. Optional header with title, description, tag, and buttons via CardStackTextBox.

description.example: Hear from those who've experienced our work

testimonial.example: This component library has transformed our development workflow. The quality and attention to detail is exceptional.
testimonial.note: Testimonial text automatically clamped to 2 lines for consistent card heights

imageSrc.note: Avatar image shown in TestimonialAuthor (aspect-square)

imageAlt.note: Alt text for avatar image

icon.note: LucideIcon component to display if no imageSrc provided (defaults to Quote icon)

itemRules.note: Works best with 8-12 testimonials. Continuously scrolls with top and bottom marquees in opposite directions.

testimonial.name: TestimonialCardSeven
testimonial.description: Vertical stack testimonial section with split card layout showing company branding and testimonial content side-by-side.
testimonial.details: Use for company testimonials with emphasis on brand identity. Uses CardList with variant system for card or border layouts. Layout: Optional TextBox Header  Vertical Stack of Testimonials. Each testimonial card has horizontal split (md breakpoint): Left side (50%): Company logo (image) OR company name (large text). Right side (50%): Quote text, author name, and optional buttons (0-2). Card variant: Items wrapped in cards with full padding (p-6 md:p-15) and mobile divider line. Border variant: Items separated by accent divider lines with bottom padding (pb-8 md:pb-10), no mobile divider. Text colors conditional on variant: border uses useInvertedBackground directly, card uses shouldUseLightText. Company name required, logo optional. Supports 0-2 buttons per testimonial with automatic primary/secondary styling via getButtonProps. Best for B2B testimonials, case studies, or client success stories where brand association is important.

description.example: Hear from teams using our platform to accelerate their development

companyName.note: Always required. Displayed as large text when no logo provided.

companyLogo.note: Optional company logo image. When provided, displays instead of company name text.

companyLogoAlt.note: Alt text for company logo. Falls back to companyName if not provided.

quote.example: Claude Code has dramatically accelerated our team's coding efficiency.

author.note: Combined name and role/title in single field

buttons.note: Optional ButtonConfig array. Supports 0-2 buttons with automatic primary/secondary styling.

itemRules.note: Works best with 3-5 testimonials for focused impact.

testimonial.name: TestimonialCardFifteen
testimonial.description: Centered testimonial with star rating, animated text, author, and avatar group.
testimonial.details: Use for showcasing a single prominent testimonial with social proof. Layout: Star Rating (5 stars at top)  Large Animated Testimonial Text (TextAnimation)  Author Name  Avatar Group. Stars show filled/unfilled based on rating value. TextAnimation uses theme's defaultTextAnimation. AvatarGroup shows 3 avatars on mobile, 6 on desktop. Best for hero-style testimonial sections or featured customer reviews.

testimonial.example: This product has completely transformed how we work. The results speak for themselves.

avatars.note: Array of avatar objects with src and alt. Shows 3 on mobile, 6 on desktop.

testimonial.usage: <TestimonialCardFifteen testimonial="This product has completely transformed how we work." rating={5} author="James Carter, Journalist" avatars={[{ src: '/avatars/user1.jpg', alt: 'User 1' }, { src: '/avatars/user2.jpg', alt: 'User 2' }]} useInvertedBackground="noInvert" />

socialProof.name: SocialProofOne
socialProof.description: Scrolling marquee logo showcase with optional card backgrounds.
socialProof.details: Use for displaying partner logos, client lists, or brand showcases. Layout: Optional TextBox Header → Scrolling Marquee with Logos. Logos scroll horizontally in an infinite loop (duplicated 4x for smooth scrolling). Optional card backgrounds with padding around each logo (default: enabled). When cards are shown: h-7 logos with mx-4 spacing and card styling. Without cards: h-8 logos with mx-8 spacing. Speed is customizable (default: 40px/s). Uses mask-padding-x for edge fade effect. All core fields required for visual consistency. Best for social proof sections, partner showcases, or brand displays. Optional header with title, description, tag, and buttons via CardStackTextBox.

description.example: Join thousands of companies that trust our platform

logos.note: Array of logo image paths. Minimum 6 logos required. Will be duplicated 4x for smooth scrolling.

speed.note: Marquee scroll speed in pixels per second

showCard.note: Show card background around each logo with padding

propsSchema.titleSegments?: TitleSegment[] - Array of { type: 'text', content: string } | { type: 'image', src: string, alt?: string } for inline images in title
propsSchema.textboxLayout: 'default' | 'split' | 'split-actions' | 'split-description' | 'inline-image' (required - 'inline-image' uses titleSegments for rich text with images)
propsSchema.textBoxTitleImageWrapperClassName?: string - For styling image wrapper in inline-image layout
propsSchema.textBoxTitleImageClassName?: string - For styling images in inline-image layout

socialProof.name: SocialProofTwo
socialProof.description: Grid logo showcase with card backgrounds.
socialProof.details: Use for displaying 2-5 partner logos in a clean grid layout with card backgrounds. Layout: Optional TextBox Header → Responsive Grid with Logo Cards. Mobile: vertical column layout with full-width logo cards. Desktop (md+): horizontal row layout with logos distributed evenly (flex-basis based on count: 1/2, 1/3, 1/4, or 1/5). Each logo displayed in a card with padding and gap-4 spacing between cards. Logo sizing: Mobile w-1/2, Desktop h-8 w-auto, 2xl h-10. Best for partner showcases, client lists with 2-5 logos where fixed grid layout with visual separation is preferred over scrolling marquee.

description.example: Join thousands of companies that trust our platform

logos.note: Array of logo image paths. Minimum 2, maximum 5 logos for optimal grid layout. Each logo is displayed in a card with padding.

socialProof.name: SocialProofThree
socialProof.description: Dual marquee logo showcase with card backgrounds scrolling in opposite directions.
socialProof.details: Use for displaying partner logos with visual impact using dual auto-scrolling marquees. Features two horizontal marquees scrolling in opposite directions (top and bottom) with logo cards. Uses AutoCarousel with dualMarquee mode. Each logo displayed in a card with h-full, rounded-theme styling, centered content. Logo images sized at h-1/2 w-1/2 within cards. Item width responsive: w-30 on mobile, w-carousel-item-3 on desktop, w-carousel-item-4 on xl screens, all with aspect-square. Top marquee direction configurable (left or right, default: left). Speed customizable (default: 40px/s). Includes full TextBox integration with all layout options (default, split, split-actions, split-description). Best for social proof sections, partner showcases with high logo count where dual scrolling creates dynamic visual interest. Automatically handles animationType for scroll-triggered effects.

description.example: Join thousands of companies that rely on our platform

logos.note: Array of logo image paths. Minimum 8 logos recommended for dual marquee effect. More logos create better visual flow.

speed.note: Marquee scroll speed in pixels per second

topMarqueeDirection.note: Direction of top marquee. Bottom marquee automatically scrolls in opposite direction.

faq.name: FaqBase
faq.description: FAQ section with accordion items and optional header.
faq.details: Use for displaying frequently asked questions in an expandable accordion format. Layout: Optional TextBox Header → Accordion List. Supports two animation types: 'smooth' (height transition) and 'instant' (immediate show/hide). Only one accordion item can be open at a time. Each FAQ requires a unique id, title (question), and content (answer). Content supports HTML for rich formatting. Optional header with title, description, tag, and buttons via CardStackTextBox. Best for FAQ pages, help sections, or any Q&A content.

description.example: Find answers to common questions about our products and services

faqs.example: [{"id": "1", "title": "What is your return policy?", "content": "We offer a 30-day money-back guarantee."}]
faqs.note: Array of FAQ items. Each item requires unique id, title (question), and content (answer with HTML support).

animationType.note: Animation type for accordion open/close. 'smooth' uses height transition, 'instant' shows/hides immediately.

faq.name: FaqDouble
faq.description: FAQ section with two-column accordion layout and optional header.
faq.details: Use for displaying frequently asked questions in a two-column layout for better space utilization. Layout: Optional TextBox Header → Card Container with Two Columns of Accordions. FAQs are automatically split into two equal columns (first half in left column, second half in right). On mobile, columns stack vertically. Supports two animation types: 'smooth' (height transition) and 'instant' (immediate show/hide). Only one accordion item can be open at a time across both columns. Each FAQ requires a unique id, title (question), and content (answer). Content supports HTML for rich formatting. Card container has rounded-theme styling. Best for FAQ pages with many questions where horizontal space is available.

faq.name: FaqSplitMedia
faq.description: FAQ section with split layout featuring media (image/video) on one side and accordion list on the other.
faq.details: Use for displaying FAQs with visual context. Layout: Optional TextBox Header → Grid with Media (2/5 width) + Accordions (3/5 width). Media can be positioned left or right via mediaPosition prop. Uses CSS Grid with auto-rows-fr to ensure media and FAQ content match height exactly. Media container has fixed height on mobile (h-80) and auto height on desktop to match FAQ content. Supports both images and videos. Only one accordion item can be open at a time. Supports two animation types: 'smooth' (height transition) and 'instant' (immediate show/hide). Each FAQ requires unique id, title (question), and content (answer with HTML support). Best for FAQ pages where visual elements enhance understanding.

description.example: Find answers to common questions about our products and services

mediaPosition.note: Position of media relative to FAQ list.

imageSrc.note: Path to image file. Either imageSrc or videoSrc should be provided.

videoSrc.note: Path to video file. Either imageSrc or videoSrc should be provided.

faq.details: Use for displaying FAQs with a prominent title and optional description. Layout: Animated Title + Description (2/5 width) | Accordions (3/5 width). blog.name: BlogCardOne
blog.description: Blog section with card grid/carousel layout featuring image, category, title, excerpt, and author info.
blog.details: Use for displaying blog posts or articles. Uses CardStack for adaptive layout (grid for 1-4 items, carousel for 5+). Card structure: Image with overlay arrow button → Category badge → Title → Excerpt → Author (avatar + name + date). Image has zoom effect on hover. Category displayed in primary-button badge. Optional header with title, description, tag, and buttons via CardStack. Best for blog pages, news sections, or article listings.

blog.name: BlogCardFour
blog.description: Blog section with TextBox header and responsive grid of compact horizontal blog cards.
blog.details: Use for blog listings with compact card layout. Layout: CardStackTextBox header → Responsive grid of blog cards. Each card has horizontal layout: small square media (h-15, aspect-square, rounded-theme-capped) on left, title and description on right. Grid adapts: 1 col mobile, 2 cols for 2 items desktop, 3 cols for 3+ items desktop. Cards use card styling with p-4 padding, gap-4 between media and content. Title is text-base, description is text-sm with line-clamp-2. Uses useCardAnimation for scroll animations. Best for blog indexes, article listings, or news sections with multiple posts.

videoAriaLabel.note: Falls back to blog title if not provided

itemRules.note: Grid layout: 1 item = 1 col, 2 items = 2 cols desktop, 3+ items = 3 cols desktop. All layouts are 1 col on mobile.
