blog.name: BlogCardFive
blog.description: Blog section with TextBox header and fixed 2-column grid layout with horizontal blog cards and metadata items.
blog.details: Use for featured blog listings with prominent display and metadata. Uses CardList variant system with two display modes: card (entire grid wrapped in card background) or plain (individual cards without background). Layout: CardStackTextBox header  Fixed 2-column grid (desktop only, 1 col mobile). Each blog card has horizontal layout on desktop (media left, content right), vertical on mobile. Media is h-50 aspect-square with rounded corners. Content shows large title (text-3xl) and inline metadata items separated by accent-colored bullets (). Card variant: Grid wrapped with card styling (rounded-theme-capped, p-5 md:p-8), text colors use shouldUseLightText logic. Plain variant: No grid background, text colors based on useInvertedBackground directly. Items array is flexible for category, date, read time, author, etc. Best for featured articles, blog highlights, or article showcases with 2-6 posts.

description.example: Discover our latest insights and stories

title.example: The Future of Web Development: Exploring New Technologies and Trends
title.note: Blog post title shown at text-3xl size, supports longer titles

items.note: Flexible metadata items (category, date, author, read time, etc.) displayed inline with bullet separators

imageSrc.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc should be provided

videoSrc.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc should be provided

imageAlt.note: Falls back to blog title if not provided

videoAriaLabel.note: Falls back to blog title if not provided

itemRules.note: Always displays as 2-column grid on desktop, 1 column on mobile. Works best with even number of posts (2, 4, 6).

blog.description: Blog section with separate media and card layout, featuring tags and arrow navigation.
blog.details: Use for blog listings with prominent imagery. Layout: CardStackTextBox header  Grid of blog items. Each item has separate media (aspect-square) above a card containing title, tags row, and arrow icon. Media and card are visually distinct with gap-6 spacing. Tags use the Tag component and arrow rotates -45deg on hover. Best for visual-focused blog listings with clean separation between imagery and content.

imageSrc.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc should be provided

videoSrc.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc should be provided

videoAriaLabel.note: Falls back to blog title if not provided

propsSchema.textBoxTitleImageClassName?: string

Best for author/team spotlights, interviews, or content with strong visual identity.

Supports both card and border styling variants. Text colors adapt based on variant and useInvertedBackground settings. Best for detailed blog listings with call-to-action buttons.

propsSchema.titleSegments?: TitleSegment[]

No media - purely text-focused layout. Text colors adapt based on variant and useInvertedBackground settings. Best for career pages, announcements, or minimal blog listings.

Best for featured blog posts, case studies, or news articles.

contact.name: ContactCenter
contact.description: Centered contact section with tag, animated title and description, email signup form, and terms text.
contact.details: Use for newsletter signups, contact forms, or email capture. Features centered layout with tag (with optional icon), animated title and description using ThemeProvider's defaultTextAnimation, EmailSignupForm component, and customizable terms text. Content is placed in a card container with rounded-theme-capped styling. Ideal for prominently placed contact/signup sections with strong visual emphasis.

description.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Suspendisse varius enim in eros elementum tristique.

termsText.default: By clicking Sign Up you're confirming that you agree with our Terms and Conditions.
termsText.example: We respect your privacy. Unsubscribe at any time.

propsSchema.title: string
propsSchema.termsText?: string (default: 'By clicking Sign Up you're confirming that you agree with our Terms and Conditions.')

contact.usage:
// Wrap in ThemeProvider
<ThemeProvider defaultButtonVariant="text-stagger" defaultTextAnimation="entrance-slide" borderRadius="rounded" background="aurora" cardStyle="glass-elevated" primaryButtonStyle="gradient" secondaryButtonStyle="glass">
  <ContactCenter tag="Newsletter" title="Stay updated with our latest news" description="Subscribe to our newsletter for weekly updates and exclusive content." useInvertedBackground={"noInvert"} onSubmit={(email) => console.log(email)} />
</ThemeProvider>

contact.name: ContactSplit
contact.description: Split layout contact section with tag, animated title and description on one side, media content on the other, and email signup form.
contact.details: Use for newsletter signups or email capture with visual context. Features split layout with ContactForm (tag with optional icon, animated title and description, EmailSignupForm) on one side and image or video media on the other. Form is placed in a card with constrained width on larger screens. Media can be positioned left or right. Media uses fixed height on desktop. Ideal for contact sections that benefit from visual storytelling alongside the signup form.

termsText.default: By clicking Sign Up you're confirming that you agree with our Terms and Conditions.

propsSchema.termsText?: string (default: 'By clicking Sign Up you're confirming that you agree with our Terms and Conditions.')

<ThemeProvider defaultButtonVariant="text-stagger" defaultTextAnimation="entrance-slide" borderRadius="rounded" background="aurora" cardStyle="glass-elevated" primaryButtonStyle="gradient" secondaryButtonStyle="glass">

contact.name: ContactCenterForm
contact.description: Centered contact form section with animated title and description, dynamic input fields, optional textarea, and submit button.
contact.details: Use for full contact forms with custom fields (name, email, message, etc.). Features centered layout with animated title and description using ThemeProvider's defaultTextAnimation, dynamic input fields array (minimum 2 required), optional textarea, and submit button. All form inputs use secondary-button styling with rounded-theme borders. Form is placed in a large card container. Returns Record<string, string> with all field values on submit. Ideal for contact pages requiring multiple user inputs beyond just email.

description.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Suspendisse varius enim in eros elementum tristique.

contact.usage:
// Wrap in ThemeProvider

</ThemeProvider>

contact.name: ContactSplitForm
contact.description: Split layout contact form with animated title and description, dynamic input fields, optional textarea, submit button, and media content.
contact.details: Use for full contact forms with visual context. Features split layout with form (animated title and description, dynamic input fields array with minimum 2 required, optional textarea, submit button) on one side and image or video media on the other. All form inputs use secondary-button styling with rounded-theme borders. Media can be positioned left or right. On mobile, media displays with natural aspect ratio; on desktop, uses absolute positioning to match form height. Returns Record<string, string> with all field values on submit. Ideal for contact pages that combine detailed forms with visual storytelling.

description.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Suspendisse varius enim in eros elementum tristique.

contact.usage:
// Wrap in ThemeProvider

Send us a message." inputs={[{ name: 'name', type: 'text', placeholder: 'Name', required: true }, { name: 'email', type: 'email', placeholder: 'Email', required: true }]} textarea={{ name: 'message', placeholder: 'Type your message...', rows: 5, required: true }} useInvertedBackground={"noInvert"} imageSrc="/placeholders/placeholder-16-9.svg" onSubmit={(data) => console.log(data)} />
</ThemeProvider>

contact.name: ContactMedia
contact.description: Full-width media contact section with centered overlay buttons on aspect-ratio media.
contact.details: Use for visual contact sections with prominent media and call-to-action buttons. Layout: Full-width section → Centered media container (w-content-width, aspect-square on mobile, aspect-video on md+, rounded-theme-capped) → MediaContent with optional overlay buttons. Buttons are centered and overlaid on the media using absolute positioning (top-1/2, left-1/2, translate). Supports up to 2 buttons with px-8 spacing. Media uses object-cover to fill container. Optional inverted background for section. All core fields required for visual consistency. Best for contact pages, inquiry sections, or call-to-action displays with strong visual emphasis.

imageSrc.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc should be provided

videoSrc.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc should be provided

imageAlt.note: Alt text for contact image

videoAriaLabel.note: ARIA label for contact video

buttonRules.note: Supports up to 2 buttons overlaid on media. Buttons are centered and use px-8 spacing.

contact.usage: <ContactMedia imageSrc="/contact.jpg" imageAlt="Contact us" buttons={[{ text: 'Get in Touch', href: '/contact' }]} useInvertedBackground={"noInvert"} />

contact.name: ContactText
contact.description: Centered contact section with animated text and action buttons in a card container.
contact.details: Use for simple, focused contact call-to-actions with emphasis on messaging. Layout: Section wrapper with optional inverted background → Card container (w-content-width, card class, rounded-theme-capped, py-20 px-10) → Centered content area (w-3/4 on md+) with TextAnimation heading and buttons. Text uses GSAP scroll-triggered animation (words-trigger variant) with configurable animation type (entrance-slide, reveal-blur, or background-highlight). Supports up to 2 buttons with px-8 spacing in flex layout. Card background adapts to theme.cardStyle. Text color determined by shouldUseInvertedText utility based on useInvertedBackground and cardStyle. Best for clean contact sections, inquiry prompts, or call-to-action blocks with animated messaging.

text.example: Ready to start your next project? Let's create something amazing together.

animationType.note: GSAP scroll-triggered animation type for text

buttonRules.note: Supports up to 2 buttons with px-8 spacing. Buttons use theme.defaultButtonVariant.

contact.usage: <ContactText text="Ready to start your next project? Let's create something amazing together." animationType="entrance-slide" buttons={[{ text: 'Get in Touch', href: '/contact' }, { text: 'View Portfolio', href: '/portfolio' }]} useInvertedBackground="noInvert" />

contact.name: ContactParallax
contact.description: Full-screen parallax contact section with fixed background media and centered overlay buttons.
contact.details: Use for immersive contact sections with parallax scrolling effect. Layout: Full-screen section (h-svh) with clip-path → Fixed background media (position: fixed, inset-0) → Centered overlay buttons (z-10, flexbox centered). The fixed positioning creates a parallax effect as the user scrolls. Media uses object-cover with rounded-none to fill entire viewport. Supports up to 2 buttons with px-8 spacing, centered both horizontally and vertically. Best for hero-style contact sections, dramatic call-to-action displays, or immersive inquiry pages. Requires surrounding content sections for parallax effect to be visible.

imageSrc.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc should be provided

videoSrc.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc should be provided

imageAlt.note: Alt text for contact image

videoAriaLabel.note: ARIA label for contact video

buttonRules.note: Supports up to 2 buttons overlaid on media. Buttons are centered in viewport and use px-8 spacing.

layoutRules.note: Component uses h-svh and should be surrounded by other content sections for parallax effect to be visible during scroll.

contact.usage: <ContactParallax imageSrc="/contact.jpg" imageAlt="Contact us" buttons={[{ text: 'Get in Touch', href: '/contact' }]} />

contact.name: ContactInline
contact.description: Inline contact section with animated heading on left and email signup form on right.
contact.details: Use for simple, inline contact/CTA sections. Layout: Animated heading (left, 50%) + EmailSignupForm (right, 50%). Mobile: vertical stack. Desktop: horizontal 50/50 split. Heading uses TextAnimation with words-trigger variant. Form includes email input and button in a single card (EmailSignupForm component). Best for newsletter signups, waitlist forms, or simple contact inquiries. Clean, minimal layout focuses attention on the call-to-action.

text.example: What problem are you up against?
text.note: Animated heading text shown on left

inputPlaceholder.example: How can I help you today?

animationType.note: Animation type for heading text (TextAnimation component)

contact.usage: <ContactInline text="What problem are you up against?" inputPlaceholder="How can I help you today?" buttonText="Ask Claude" onSubmit={(email) => console.log(email)} useInvertedBackground={"noInvert"} />

contact.name: ContactFaq
contact.description: Split-panel contact section with CTA card on left and FAQ accordions on right.
contact.details: Use for combining contact CTA with frequently asked questions. Layout: Left Panel (4 cols) - Icon  Title  Description  CTA Button. Right Panel (8 cols) - FAQ Accordions. CTA panel uses card styling with centered content and primary-button icon container. FAQ accordions support both smooth and instant animation types. Best for sales/support pages requiring both contact options and common questions. Grid-based layout (12-column system) for responsive behavior.

ctaDescription.example: Let's get started with a brief intro call.

content.example: Your subscription covers end-to-end digital design services...

propsSchema.faqs: Array<{ id: string, title: string, content: string }>
propsSchema.ctaButton: ButtonConfig - { text: string, href?: string, onClick?: () => void }
propsSchema.animationType: 'none' | 'opacity' | 'slide-up' | 'scale-rotate' | 'blur-reveal' (required - controls GSAP scroll animations with stagger effect on panels)
propsSchema.showCard?: boolean (default: true - controls accordion card styling)

contact.usage: <ContactFaq faqs={[{ id: '1', title: "What's included?", content: 'Your subscription covers...' }]} ctaTitle="Book an intro call" ctaDescription="Let's get started with a brief intro call." ctaButton={{ text: 'Book a Free Call', href: '#contact' }} ctaIcon={Phone} useInvertedBackground="noInvert" animationType="slide-up" />

footer.name: FooterBase
footer.description: Classic footer with logo, multi-column navigation, copyright text, and privacy policy link.
footer.details: Use for standard website footers with organized navigation. Features logo (image or text fallback) on left, flexible column layout for navigation links, copyright text, and privacy policy button. If logoSrc is not provided, displays logoText as h2 heading. All links use ButtonTextUnderline component. Footer uses primary-button background with text-background color scheme.

columns.note: Each column must have title and items array

structure.label: string - Link text (required)
structure.href: string - Link destination (optional). External URLs (https://, http://, www.) open in new tab. Internal values (e.g., 'about', 'contact') scroll to #about, #contact sections

footer.usage: <FooterBase columns={[{ title: 'Product', items: [{ label: 'Features', href: 'features' }, { label: 'Pricing', href: 'pricing' }] }]} copyrightText="© 2025 | Company" onPrivacyClick={() => console.log('Privacy clicked')} />

footer.name: FooterMedia
footer.description: Footer with full-width media (image/video) above classic navigation layout.
footer.details: Use for visually impactful footers with media. Features full-width image or video at top with mask-fade-top-long effect (fades from top), followed by standard footer layout: logo, multi-column navigation, copyright, and privacy policy. Media is required (either imageSrc or videoSrc). Same navigation structure as FooterBase.

mediaRules.note: Either imageSrc or videoSrc is required (discriminated union)

columns.note: Each column must have title and items array

footer.usage: <FooterMedia imageSrc="https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1497215728101-856f4ea42174?w=1920" columns={[{ title: 'Product', items: [{ label: 'Features', href: 'features' }, { label: 'Pricing', href: 'pricing' }] }]} copyrightText="© 2025 | Company" />

footer.name: FooterSocial
footer.description: Modern footer component with prominent social media icons and multi-column navigation.
footer.details: Use when you want to emphasize social media presence. Features logo (image or text fallback), copyright text, social media icon links in card containers, and responsive multi-column navigation. Social icons display in circular card containers. Columns display 2 per row on mobile, expanding to horizontal layout on desktop.

columns.note: Each column must have title and items array. Displays 2 per row on mobile.

socialLinks.note: Each social link must have icon (LucideIcon), href (string), and ariaLabel (string). Links open in new tab.

footer.usage: <FooterSocial logoText="Bevel" columns={[{ title: 'Company', items: [{ label: 'About us', href: 'about' }] }, { title: 'Product', items: [{ label: 'Features', href: 'features' }] }]} socialLinks={[{ icon: Instagram, href: 'https://instagram.com', ariaLabel: 'Instagram' }]} copyrightText="© Finerpoint, Inc. 2025" />

footer.name: FooterBaseReveal
footer.description: Animated footer reveal wrapper that creates a fixed footer with scroll-triggered reveal effect.
footer.details: Use when you want the footer to stay fixed at the bottom and reveal as users scroll. Wraps FooterBase component with fixed positioning and dynamic height calculation using ResizeObserver. Creates a reveal animation effect as content scrolls up. Ideal for modern, engaging scroll experiences.

columns.note: Each column must have title and items array

structure.label: string - Link text (required)
structure.href: string - Link destination (optional). External URLs open in new tab, internal values scroll to sections

footer.usage: <FooterBaseReveal columns={[{ title: 'Product', items: [{ label: 'Features', href: 'features' }, { label: 'Pricing', href: 'pricing' }] }]} copyrightText="© 2025 | Company" />

footer.name: FooterLogoEmphasis
footer.description: Footer with prominent centered logo emphasis and grid-based navigation layout with chevron icons.
footer.details: Use when logo branding is primary focus in footer. Features large centered logo at top (image or SVG text), followed by responsive grid of navigation links (1-5 columns max) with ChevronRight icons. Grid columns automatically adjust based on number of column arrays provided. No column titles - just clean link lists. Uses primary-button background with rounded-t-theme-capped styling.

columns.note: Grid automatically adjusts from 1-5 columns based on array length

structure.label: string - Link text (required)
structure.href: string - Link destination (optional). External URLs open in new tab, internal values scroll to sections

logo.note: Either logoSrc (image) or logoText (SVG) can be used. If logoSrc provided, it takes precedence

footer.usage: <FooterLogoEmphasis columns={[{ items: [{ label: 'Features', href: 'features' }] }, { items: [{ label: 'About', href: 'about' }] }]} logoText="Company" />

footer.name: FooterCard
footer.description: Minimalist footer with card wrapper containing logo, divider, copyright, and optional social links.
footer.details: Use for simple, clean footer layouts with card styling. Layout: Section wrapper (py-20) → Card container (w-content-width, rounded-theme-capped, px-10) → FooterLogo → Divider line (h-px, bg-accent/20) → Bottom section (copyright text + optional social links). Logo supports either image (logoSrc) or SVG text (logoText via FooterLogo component). Divider uses accent color with 20% opacity. Bottom section displays copyright (text-accent/75, text-sm) on left and optional social icons on right in flex row (mobile: stacks vertically). Social links are conditionally rendered only when provided. All elements contained within card for unified appearance. Best for simple, modern footer designs without extensive navigation. Uses semantic footer tag with contentinfo role.

copyrightText.note: Copyright text displayed at bottom left

logoText.note: Text used for SVG logo when logoSrc not provided

socialLinksRules.note: Optional array of social links. Only renders if provided and has length > 0.

logoRules.note: Either logoSrc (image) or logoText (SVG) can be used. If logoSrc provided, it takes precedence in FooterLogo component.

footer.usage: <FooterCard logoText="Webild" copyrightText="© 2025 | Webild" socialLinks={[{ icon: Twitter, href: 'https://twitter.com/webild', ariaLabel: 'Twitter' }, { icon: Linkedin, href: 'https://linkedin.com/company/webild', ariaLabel: 'LinkedIn' }]} />

footer.name: FooterBaseCard
footer.description: Card-wrapped footer with logo, navigation columns, copyright, and privacy policy link.
footer.details: Use for footers that need comprehensive navigation within a card container. Layout: Section wrapper (py-20) → Card container (w-content-width, rounded-theme-capped, p-10) → Top section (logo + FooterColumns in flex-row) → Border divider (border-t, border-foreground/20) → Bottom section (copyright + privacy button). Logo supports either image (logoSrc with Next.js Image) or text heading (logoText, text-4xl). Navigation organized via FooterColumns component accepting array of column objects with title and items. Bottom section displays copyright text (text-foreground/50, text-sm) on left and privacy policy button (ButtonTextUnderline) on right in flex row. Card wrapper provides unified, elevated appearance compared to FooterBase. Text colors use foreground variants since content is within card element. Best for comprehensive footer navigation with modern card styling. Uses semantic footer tag with contentinfo role.

copyrightText.note: Copyright text displayed at bottom left

logoText.note: Text used for heading when logoSrc not provided

structure.title: string - Column heading (required)
structure.items: Array<{ label: string, href: string }> - Navigation links (required)

columnsRules.note: Array of footer column objects. Each column must have title and items array.

logoRules.note: Either logoSrc (image) or logoText (heading) can be used. If logoSrc provided, it takes precedence over logoText.

footer.usage: <FooterBaseCard columns={[{ title: 'Product', items: [{ label: 'Features', href: '/features' }, { label: 'Pricing', href: '/pricing' }] }, { title: 'Company', items: [{ label: 'About', href: '/about' }, { label: 'Blog', href: '/blog' }] }]} logoText="Webild" copyrightText="© 2025 | Webild" onPrivacyClick={() => console.log('Privacy clicked')} />

footer.name: FooterSplit
footer.description: Card-wrapped footer with navigation columns, prominent title with optional avatars, logo, and contact information.
footer.details: Use for footers that highlight a key message or value proposition alongside navigation. Layout: Card container with two main sections - Top: Navigation columns (left) + Large title with optional avatar group (right). Bottom: Logo (image or text) + Contact items with icons. Title is required and prominently displayed. Contact items use icon-text pairs for phone, email, address, etc. Best for modern, marketing-focused footers that emphasize brand messaging. Uses semantic footer tag with contentinfo role.

title.example: Complete protection for every stage of your practice
title.note: Prominent title displayed on right side of footer

logoText.note: Text used for logo when logoSrc not provided

structure.title: string - Column heading (required)
structure.items: Array<{ label: string, href: string }> - Navigation links (required)

columnsRules.note: Navigation columns displayed on left side. Each column must have title and items array.

contactItemsRules.note: Array of contact items displayed at bottom right with icons. Common icons: Phone, Mail, MapPin.

avatarsRules.note: Optional array of team member avatars displayed below title using AvatarGroup component.

logoRules.note: Either logoSrc (image) or logoText (heading) can be used. If logoSrc provided, displays as image with specified width/height.

footer.usage: <FooterSplit columns={[{ title: 'Product', items: [{ label: 'Features', href: '/features' }] }]} title="Complete protection for every stage of your practice" contactItems={[{ icon: Phone, text: '(914) 820-5734' }, { icon: Mail, text: 'contact@webild.com' }]} avatars={[{ src: '/team1.jpg', alt: 'Team member' }]} logoText="Webild" />

footer.name: FooterLogoReveal
footer.description: Minimalist footer with logo that reveals on scroll using fixed positioning and clip-path.
footer.details: Use for minimal, logo-only footers with scroll reveal effect. Footer stays fixed at bottom and reveals as user scrolls down the page using clip-path animation. Contains only FooterLogo component (supports image or SVG text logo) centered with card styling. Uses ResizeObserver to dynamically track footer height for proper reveal effect. Best for clean, modern designs where footer should not distract from content. Uses semantic section and footer tags with contentinfo role.

logoText.note: Text used for SVG logo when logoSrc not provided

logoRules.note: Either logoSrc (image) or logoText (SVG) can be used. If logoSrc provided, displays as image with full width. If not provided, uses SvgTextLogo with logoText.

revealEffectRules.note: Component uses fixed positioning and clip-path for scroll reveal effect. Requires page content above footer to trigger scroll. ResizeObserver dynamically updates footer height for responsive reveal.

footer.name: FooterBaseSocial
footer.description: Footer with logo, description, social links, and multi-column navigation.
footer.details: Use for footers that need both description text and social media links alongside navigation. Features logo (image or text fallback), description below logo, social media icons at the bottom of the left column, and flexible column layout for navigation links. Social icons and description fill the left column height to match navigation columns. Footer uses primary-button background with text-background color scheme.

description.example: Learn the skill that turns everyday AI into extraordinary results.

columns.note: Each column must have title and items array

socialLinks.note: Each social link must have icon (LucideIcon), href (string), and ariaLabel (string). Links open in new tab.

structure.label: string - Link text (required)
structure.href: string - Link destination (optional). External URLs (https://, http://, www.) open in new tab. Internal values (e.g., 'about', 'contact') scroll to #about, #contact sections

footer.usage: <FooterBaseSocial columns={[{ title: 'Links', items: [{ label: 'Curriculum', href: 'curriculum' }, { label: 'Pricing', href: 'pricing' }] }, { title: 'Others', items: [{ label: 'Terms of Service', href: 'terms' }, { label: 'Privacy Policy', href: 'privacy' }] }]} description="Learn the skill that turns everyday AI into extraordinary results." socialLinks={[{ icon: Youtube, href: 'https://youtube.com', ariaLabel: 'YouTube' }, { icon: Twitter, href: 'https://twitter.com', ariaLabel: 'Twitter' }]} />
